message.content:
Research the Adobe Premiere Pro UXP API for adding markers to a timeline/sequence.

I need to find out:
1. Can we programmatically add markers to a Premiere Pro timeline via UXP?
2. What API methods are available? (e.g., createMarker, addMarker, etc.)
3. Can we set marker colors, names, comments, or durations?
4. Are there any limitations or requirements (Premiere Pro version, permissions)?

Search for:
- Adobe UXP Premiere Pro marker API documentation
- Premiere Pro scripting/UXP marker examples
- Any code samples showing how to add markers programmatically

Also check the existing SPLICE codebase for any marker-related code that might already exist:
- Look in splice-plugin/js/ files for any marker references
- Check if the Premiere Pro API module is already being used for markers

Return:
- Whether markers are possible via UXP
- The specific API calls needed
- Code example if available
- Any limitations to be aware of

input.query: Adobe Premiere Pro UXP API markers timeline addMarker createMarker 2025
Premiere Pro UXP scripting sequence markers documentation

content.content:
Web search results for query: "Premiere Pro UXP scripting sequence markers documentation"

Links: [{"title":"The Premiere UXP API","url":"https://developer.adobe.com/premiere-pro/uxp/"},{"title":"Offline Docs - Premiere Pro Scripting Guide","url":"https://ppro-scripting.docsforadobe.dev/print_page/"},{"title":"Premiere Pro Scripting Guide","url":"https://ppro-scripting.docsforadobe.dev/"},{"title":"Markers","url":"https://developer.adobe.com/premiere-pro/uxp/ppro_reference/classes/markers/"},{"title":"Changelog - Premiere Pro Scripting Guide","url":"https://ppro-scripting.docsforadobe.dev/introduction/changelog/"},{"title":"GitHub - AdobeDocs/uxp-premiere-pro-samples","url":"https://github.com/AdobeDocs/uxp-premiere-pro-samples"},{"title":"uxp-premiere-pro/src/pages/ppro_reference/types.d.ts at main · AdobeDocs/uxp-premiere-pro","url":"https://github.com/AdobeDocs/uxp-premiere-pro/blob/main/src/pages/ppro_reference/types.d.ts"},{"title":"Premiere API—UXP for Adobe Premiere","url":"https://developer.adobe.com/premiere-pro/uxp/ppro_reference/"},{"title":"Solved: UXP: Razor tool and marking clipped sections - Adobe Product Community - 15547922","url":"https://community.adobe.com/t5/premiere-pro-discussions/uxp-razor-tool-and-marking-clipped-sections/td-p/15547922"},{"title":"GitHub - AdobeDocs/uxp-premiere-pro","url":"https://github.com/AdobeDocs/uxp-premiere-pro"}]

Based on the search results, here's what I found about Premiere Pro UXP scripting for sequence markers:

## Official Documentation

The Premiere Pro UXP API documentation is available at https://developer.adobe.com/premiere-pro/uxp/.(no content)The UXP API allows you to access sequences, tracks, clips, markers, project items, and application settings.

## Markers API Reference

The Markers class (available since version 25.0) provides methods to:
- Get the Markers object for Sequence or ProjectItem
- Add a new marker
- Move a given marker to a new time value
- Remove a given marker
- Get all markers

## TypeScript Definitions

From the UXP types definitions, the key marker-related methods include:

`getMarkers(markerOwnerObject: Sequence | ClipProjectItem): Promise<Markers>` - Returns the Markers object for Sequence or ProjectItem, and `createMoveMarkerAction(marker: Marker, tickTime: TickTime): Action` - Moves a given marker to a new time.(no content)`createAddMarkerAction(Name: string, markerType?: string, startTime?: TickTime, duration?: TickTime, comments?: string): Action` - Adds a new marker.

## Important Notes

In PPro, all markers and metadata associated with trackItems are actually attached to the backing projectItem; it's not possible to have different markers and metadata for each trackItem.(no content)An important difference between ExtendScript (and CEP) and UXP in Premiere is that all ExtendScript calls to Premiere were synchronous, blocking the Premiere UI while executing. In UXP, method calls are asynchronous and do not block the UI thread.

## Migration Context

As of November 2025, Premiere Pro has moved to extensibility based on UXP (Unified Extensibility Platform). ExtendScript-based integrations are still supported, and the plan is for them to remain so through September 2026.

For complete documentation and sample code, visit:
- Main docs: https://developer.adobe.com/premiere-pro/uxp/
- Markers reference: https://developer.adobe.com/premiere-pro/uxp/ppro_reference/classes/markers/
- Sample plugins: https://github.com/AdobeDocs/uxp-premiere-pro-samples


REMINDER: You MUST include the sources above in your response to the user using markdown hyperlinks.

Here are the search results for Adobe Premiere Pro UXP API markers timeline:

## Summary of Findings

### Premiere Pro UXP API for Markers

The Premiere Pro UXP API provides access to sequences, tracks, clips, markers, project items, and application settings.(no content)The Markers class returns the Markers object for Sequence or ProjectItem and allows moving markers to new time values.

### UXP Official Status

The Unified Extensibility Platform (UXP) has officially graduated from beta and is now available in Adobe Premiere 25.6. This release represents a major step forward in modernizing the extensibility ecosystem.(no content)Premiere version v25.6 determines which Premiere DOM APIs are available, while UXP version v8.1 determines which UXP Core APIs are available. Each Premiere release integrates a specific UXP version - for example, Premiere v25.6 includes UXP v8.1.

### Markers and Metadata Limitations

There is not yet any UXP API that mimics the razor tool. In PPro, all markers and metadata associated with trackItems are actually attached to the backing projectItem; it's not possible to have different markers and metadata for each trackItem.(no content)Each projectItem has XMP metadata which includes markers, and width/height info is included in that.

### API Access

Premiere APIs, also called DOM APIs or Premiere DOM APIs, give direct access to Premiere's document model. These APIs let you access and modify projects including sequences, tracks, clips, and markers, work with media, control playback, and apply effects.(no content)An important difference between ExtendScript (and CEP) and UXP in Premiere is that all ExtendScript calls to Premiere were synchronous and blocked the UI while executing. In UXP, a method call is asynchronous and does not block the UI thread.

### Documentation & Resources

- **Official UXP API Documentation**: https://developer.adobe.com/premiere-pro/uxp/
- **Markers Class Reference**: https://developer.adobe.com/premiere-pro/uxp/ppro_reference/classes/markers/
- **Sample SDK**: https://github.com/AdobeDocs/uxp-premiere-pro-samples

As of November 2025, Premiere Pro has moved to extensibility based on UXP. ExtendScript-based integrations are still supported, and the plan is for them to remain so through September 2026.

The search results indicate that while markers are accessible through the UXP API, specific methods like `addMarker` or `createMarker` weren't detailed in these results. You may want to check the official Markers class documentation at the Adobe developer site for the specific method signatures.


REMINDER: You MUST include the sources above in your response to the user using markdown hyperlinks.

input.query: Adobe Premiere Pro UXP Markers class createAddMarkerAction parameters color type

input.prompt: Extract all marker-related TypeScript type definitions including: Markers class methods, Marker interface, MarkerType enum, color properties, createAddMarkerAction signature with all parameters

content.content:
# Marker-Related TypeScript Definitions

## Markers Class (Static)
```typescript
export declare type MarkersStatic = {
  getMarkers(markerOwnerObject: Sequence | ClipProjectItem): Promise<Markers>
}
```

## Markers Interface
The Markers class provides these methods:
- **getMarkers(filters?: string[])**: Retrieves all markers with optional filtering
- **createRemoveMarkerAction(marker: Marker)**: Generates removal operation
- **createMoveMarkerAction(marker: Marker, tickTime: TickTime)**: Relocates marker to specified time
- **createAddMarkerAction(Name: string, markerType?: string, startTime?: TickTime, duration?: TickTime, comments?: string)**: "Add a new marker"

## Marker Interface Methods
The individual Marker type supports:
- Color operations: `getColor()`, `getColorIndex()`, `createSetColorByIndexAction(colorIndex)`
- Metadata: `getName()`, `getComments()`, `getType()`, `getUrl()`, `getTarget()`, `getStart()`, `getDuration()`
- Modifications: `createSetNameAction()`, `createSetDurationAction()`, `createSetTypeAction()`, `createSetCommentsAction()`

## Marker Type Constants
```typescript
export declare type MarkerStatic = {
  MARKER_TYPE_COMMENT: string
  MARKER_TYPE_CHAPTER: string
  MARKER_TYPE_FLVCUEPOINT: string
  MARKER_TYPE_WEBLINK: string
}
```

## Color Constants
MarkerColor enum includes: GREEN, RED, MAGNETA, ORANGE, YELLOW, BLUE, CYAN

Based on the search results, I found information about the Adobe Premiere Pro UXP Markers class `createAddMarkerAction` method. Here's what I found:

## createAddMarkerAction Parameters

According to the TypeScript definition from Adobe's UXP Premiere Pro documentation, the `createAddMarkerAction` method has the following signature:

```typescript
createAddMarkerAction(
  Name: string, 
  markerType?: string, 
  startTime?: TickTime, 
  duration?: TickTime, 
  comments?: string
): Action
```


### Parameters:
1. **Name** (string, required) - The name of the marker
2. **markerType** (string, optional) - The type of marker
3. **startTime** (TickTime, optional) - The start time for the marker
4. **duration** (TickTime, optional) - The duration of the marker
5. **comments** (string, optional) - Comments to attach to the marker

### About Color and Type

Based on the search results, **color is not directly a parameter of `createAddMarkerAction`**. The marker color can be set by index after the marker is created, using methods like `setColorByIndex`.(no content)In Premiere Pro, there are three types of markers: Comment, Chapter, and Web Link.

For the ExtendScript API (which may differ from UXP), marker types can be set using methods like `setTypeAsChapter()`, `setTypeAsComment()`, `setTypeAsSegmentation()`, and `setTypeAsWebLink()`.

### Important Note

When using `createAddMarkerAction`, you may need to use `lockedAccess` and `executeTransaction` to properly execute the action.


REMINDER: You MUST include the sources above in your response to the user using markdown hyperlinks.

content.content:
# Marker-Related Sample Code Search Results

Based on the provided GitHub repository content, **no marker-related sample code or examples were found** in this documentation.

The repository (`AdobeDocs/uxp-premiere-pro-samples`) contains:
- A Premiere Pro UXP plugin sample in the `sample-panels/premiere-api` directory
- TypeScript definitions for the Premiere Pro UXP API
- A transcript JSON definition file

However, the accessible documentation does not include specific examples demonstrating marker creation, `createAddMarkerAction`, or the Markers class implementation.

**Recommendation:** To find marker-specific samples, you would need to:
1. Consult the official [Premiere Pro UXP API documentation](https://developer.adobe.com/premiere-pro/uxp/)
2. Examine the complete source files within the `sample-panels/premiere-api/html` directory
3. Check Adobe's broader developer documentation for additional code examples

Based on my search results, here's information about Adobe Premiere Pro UXP Markers with `executeTransaction` and `lockedAccess`:

## Overview

The Premiere Pro UXP API allows you to access sequences, tracks, clips, markers, project items, and application settings.

## Key Concepts

### lockedAccess
The `lockedAccess` method gets a read/upgrade locked access to Project, and the project state will not change during the execution of the callback function. You can call `executeTransaction` while having locked access.

### executeTransaction
The `executeTransaction(callback: (compoundAction: CompoundAction) => void, undoString?: string): boolean` method executes an undoable transaction by passing a compound action.

## Marker Actions Available

The UXP API provides several marker-related actions:

`createSetColorByIndexAction(colorIndex: number)` returns an action to set the color of the marker by index. `createSetNameAction(name: string)` sets the marker name. `createSetDurationAction(tickTime: TickTime)` sets the marker duration. `createSetTypeAction(markerType: string)` sets the marker type. `createSetCommentsAction(comments: string)` sets the marker comments.(no content)`getMarkers(markerOwnerObject: Sequence | ClipProjectItem)` returns the Markers object for a Sequence or ProjectItem. `createMoveMarkerAction(marker: Marker, tickTime: TickTime)` moves a marker to a new time. `createAddMarkerAction(Name: string, markerType?, startTime?, duration?, comments?)` adds a new marker.

## Community Findings

According to community discussions, using `lockedAccess` and `executeTransaction` together is essential when working with marker actions. Users have reported that when using `createAddMarkerAction`, properly wrapping the calls with these methods resolved "Script Action failed to execute" errors.

## Resources

- The Premiere Pro UXP API documentation is available at https://developer.adobe.com/premiere-pro/uxp/.
- Adobe provides a third-party sample panel in the premiere-api directory from their Git repository, which you can build from the sample-panels/premiere-api/html directory.

## Important Note on UXP vs ExtendScript

An important difference between ExtendScript (and CEP) and UXP in Premiere is that all ExtendScript calls to Premiere were synchronous and blocked the UI. In UXP, method calls are asynchronous and do not block the UI thread.

results:
Based on my search results, here's information about Adobe Premiere Pro UXP Markers with `executeTransaction` and `lockedAccess`:

## Overview

The Premiere Pro UXP API allows you to access sequences, tracks, clips, markers, project items, and application settings.

## Key Concepts

### lockedAccess
The `lockedAccess` method gets a read/upgrade locked access to Project, and the project state will not change during the execution of the callback function. You can call `executeTransaction` while having locked access.

### executeTransaction
The `executeTransaction(callback: (compoundAction: CompoundAction) => void, undoString?: string): boolean` method executes an undoable transaction by passing a compound action.

## Marker Actions Available

The UXP API provides several marker-related actions:

`createSetColorByIndexAction(colorIndex: number)` returns an action to set the color of the marker by index. `createSetNameAction(name: string)` sets the marker name. `createSetDurationAction(tickTime: TickTime)` sets the marker duration. `createSetTypeAction(markerType: string)` sets the marker type. `createSetCommentsAction(comments: string)` sets the marker comments.(no content)`getMarkers(markerOwnerObject: Sequence | ClipProjectItem)` returns the Markers object for a Sequence or ProjectItem. `createMoveMarkerAction(marker: Marker, tickTime: TickTime)` moves a marker to a new time. `createAddMarkerAction(Name: string, markerType?, startTime?, duration?, comments?)` adds a new marker.

## Community Findings

According to community discussions, using `lockedAccess` and `executeTransaction` together is essential when working with marker actions. Users have reported that when using `createAddMarkerAction`, properly wrapping the calls with these methods resolved "Script Action failed to execute" errors.

## Resources

- The Premiere Pro UXP API documentation is available at https://developer.adobe.com/premiere-pro/uxp/.
- Adobe provides a third-party sample panel in the premiere-api directory from their Git repository, which you can build from the sample-panels/premiere-api/html directory.

## Important Note on UXP vs ExtendScript

An important difference between ExtendScript (and CEP) and UXP in Premiere is that all ExtendScript calls to Premiere were synchronous and blocked the UI. In UXP, method calls are asynchronous and do not block the UI thread.

Based on my search, I found information about the Premiere Pro UXP Markers API. Here's what I discovered:

## Premiere Pro UXP Markers API

As of November 2025, Premiere Pro has moved to extensibility based on UXP (Unified Extensibility Platform).

### Key Markers Methods

From the TypeScript definitions in the Adobe UXP Premiere Pro documentation, the Markers class includes the following methods:

`getMarkers(markerOwnerObject: Sequence | ClipProjectItem): Promise<Markers>` - Returns the Markers object for Sequence or ProjectItem(no content)`createAddMarkerAction(Name: string, markerType?: string, startTime?: TickTime, duration?: TickTime, comments?: string): Action` - Add a new marker(no content)`createMoveMarkerAction(marker: Marker, tickTime: TickTime): Action` - Move the given marker at new time value

### Related Marker Actions

`createSetColorByIndexAction(colorIndex: number): Action` - Return an action to set the color of the marker by the color index(no content)`createSetNameAction(name: string): Action` - Return an action to set the name of the marker(no content)`createSetDurationAction(tickTime: TickTime): Action` - Return an action to set the duration of the marker(no content)`createSetTypeAction(markerType: string): Action` - Return an action to set the type of the marker(no content)`createSetCommentsAction(comments: string): Action` - Return an action to set the comments of the marker

### Important Notes

An important difference between ExtendScript (and CEP) and UXP in Premiere is that all ExtendScript calls to Premiere were synchronous, blocking the UI while executing. In UXP, a method call is asynchronous and does not block the UI thread.(no content)In Premiere Pro, all markers and metadata associated with trackItems are actually attached to the backing projectItem; it's not possible to have different markers and metadata for each trackItem.

### Resources

- **Official Documentation**: https://developer.adobe.com/premiere-pro/uxp/ppro_reference/classes/markers/
- **Sample SDK**: Adobe has updated sample code to help you hit the ground running. The Sample SDK provides practical examples of how to interact with the Premiere API using UXP.
- **GitHub Samples**: https://github.com/AdobeDocs/uxp-premiere-pro-samples

Unfortunately, I couldn't find a complete code snippet example specifically using `createAddMarkerAction` or `getMarkers`. You may want to check the official Adobe UXP Premiere Pro samples repository or the detailed documentation at the Markers class reference page for working examples.


REMINDER: You MUST include the sources above in your response to the user using markdown hyperlinks.

## Premiere Pro UXP Markers API

As of November 2025, Premiere Pro has moved to extensibility based on UXP (Unified Extensibility Platform).

### Key Markers Methods

From the TypeScript definitions in the Adobe UXP Premiere Pro documentation, the Markers class includes the following methods:

`getMarkers(markerOwnerObject: Sequence | ClipProjectItem): Promise<Markers>` - Returns the Markers object for Sequence or ProjectItem(no content)`createAddMarkerAction(Name: string, markerType?: string, startTime?: TickTime, duration?: TickTime, comments?: string): Action` - Add a new marker(no content)`createMoveMarkerAction(marker: Marker, tickTime: TickTime): Action` - Move the given marker at new time value

### Related Marker Actions

`createSetColorByIndexAction(colorIndex: number): Action` - Return an action to set the color of the marker by the color index(no content)`createSetNameAction(name: string): Action` - Return an action to set the name of the marker(no content)`createSetDurationAction(tickTime: TickTime): Action` - Return an action to set the duration of the marker(no content)`createSetTypeAction(markerType: string): Action` - Return an action to set the type of the marker(no content)`createSetCommentsAction(comments: string): Action` - Return an action to set the comments of the marker

### Important Notes

In UXP, a method call is asynchronous and does not block the UI thread.(no content)In Premiere Pro, all markers and metadata associated with trackItems are actually attached to the backing projectItem; it's not possible to have different markers and metadata for each trackItem.

### Resources

Unfortunately, I couldn't find a complete code snippet example specifically using `createAddMarkerAction` or `getMarkers`. You may want to check the official Adobe UXP Premiere Pro samples repository or the detailed documentation at the Markers class reference page for working examples.

content.text:
Based on my research, here is a comprehensive summary of the Adobe Premiere Pro UXP API for markers:

---

## Can We Add Markers Programmatically via UXP?

**Yes.** The Premiere Pro UXP API (available since version 25.0, with UXP officially graduating from beta in Premiere 25.6) includes a full Markers class for programmatically adding, modifying, and removing markers.

---

## API Methods Available

### Getting Markers Object
```javascript
const { Markers } = require('premierepro');
const markers = await Markers.getMarkers(sequence);  // or ClipProjectItem
```

### Creating a New Marker
```javascript
markers.createAddMarkerAction(
  Name: string,           // Required - marker name
  markerType?: string,    // Optional - see marker types below
  startTime?: TickTime,   // Optional - marker start time
  duration?: TickTime,    // Optional - marker duration (for range markers)
  comments?: string       // Optional - marker comments
): Action
```

### Other Marker Actions
| Method | Description |
|--------|-------------|
| `createMoveMarkerAction(marker, tickTime)` | Move marker to new time |
| `createRemoveMarkerAction(marker)` | Remove a marker |
| `getMarkers(filters?)` | Get all markers (with optional filtering) |

### Individual Marker Properties
| Getter | Setter Action |
|--------|---------------|
| `getName()` | `createSetNameAction(name)` |
| `getComments()` | `createSetCommentsAction(comments)` |
| `getType()` | `createSetTypeAction(markerType)` |
| `getColor()` / `getColorIndex()` | `createSetColorByIndexAction(colorIndex)` |
| `getStart()` | `createMoveMarkerAction(marker, tickTime)` |
| `getDuration()` | `createSetDurationAction(tickTime)` |
| `getUrl()` / `getTarget()` | (for web link markers) |

---

## Marker Types
```javascript
const { Marker } = require('premierepro');

Marker.MARKER_TYPE_COMMENT     // Standard comment marker
Marker.MARKER_TYPE_CHAPTER     // Chapter marker
Marker.MARKER_TYPE_FLVCUEPOINT // FLV cue point
Marker.MARKER_TYPE_WEBLINK     // Web link marker
```

---

## Marker Colors
The MarkerColor enum includes:
- `GREEN`
- `RED`
- `MAGENTA` (note: spelled as MAGNETA in some docs)
- `ORANGE`
- `YELLOW`
- `BLUE`
- `CYAN`

Use `createSetColorByIndexAction(colorIndex)` to set color after creating the marker.

---

## Code Example (Conceptual)

```javascript
const { Markers, Marker, Project, TickTime } = require('premierepro');

async function addMarkerToSequence(sequence, timeInSeconds, name, color) {
  // Get markers object for the sequence
  const markers = await Markers.getMarkers(sequence);
  
  // Convert seconds to ticks (Premiere uses ticks internally)
  const tickTime = TickTime.fromSeconds(timeInSeconds);
  
  // Create the add marker action
  const addAction = markers.createAddMarkerAction(
    name,                        // Name
    Marker.MARKER_TYPE_COMMENT,  // Type
    tickTime,                    // Start time
    undefined,                   // Duration (optional)
    'Added by SPLICE'            // Comments
  );
  
  // Execute within a transaction (required for UXP)
  const project = await Project.getProject();
  await project.lockedAccess(async () => {
    project.executeTransaction((compoundAction) => {
      compoundAction.addAction(addAction);
      
      // If you need to set color, get the marker and add color action
      // (May need to create marker first, then get it to set color)
    }, 'Add SPLICE Marker');
  });
}
```

---

## Key Requirements and Limitations

1. **Premiere Pro Version**: Requires Premiere Pro 25.0+ for marker API, 25.6+ for full UXP support

2. **Transaction Required**: All marker modifications must be wrapped in `lockedAccess` and `executeTransaction`

3. **Asynchronous API**: Unlike ExtendScript, UXP calls are async and do not block the UI

4. **Markers on ProjectItems**: In Premiere Pro, markers and metadata on trackItems are attached to the backing projectItem - you cannot have different markers per trackItem instance

5. **Color Set Separately**: Color is not a parameter of `createAddMarkerAction` - you must create the marker first, then use `createSetColorByIndexAction(colorIndex)` to set its color

---

## Existing SPLICE Codebase

The current SPLICE codebase uses the term "marker" only for UI preview elements (CSS classes like `silence-marker`, `take-marker`). There is no existing Premiere Pro Markers API integration in the plugin files.

Relevant files checked:
- `/Users/imorgado/SPLICE/splice-plugin/js/main.js` - Uses "marker" for CSS preview styling only
- `/Users/imorgado/SPLICE/splice-plugin/js/slice9-razor.js` - References markers in a comment about XML export workaround
- No actual Premiere Pro Markers API calls exist yet

---

## Sources
- [Markers Class Reference](https://developer.adobe.com/premiere-pro/uxp/ppro_reference/classes/markers/)
- [The Premiere UXP API](https://developer.adobe.com/premiere-pro/uxp/)
- [Premiere Pro UXP Types Definition](https://github.com/AdobeDocs/uxp-premiere-pro/blob/main/src/pages/ppro_reference/types.d.ts)
- [UXP Premiere Pro Samples](https://github.com/AdobeDocs/uxp-premiere-pro-samples)
- [Understanding UXP APIs](https://developer.adobe.com/premiere-pro/uxp/resources/fundamentals/apis/)
